p: The impacts of climate-related disasters are well documented. For example, in recent years, the three northern regions of Ghana have experienced extreme climate change pressures such as droughts, floods and heavy storms. In 2007, these three regions experienced a serious flood which claimed 31 lives, displaced about 102,250 people, destroyed 39 dams, 45 schools, 58 bridges and culverts in the Upper East Region alone [ 5]. WaSH facilities such as public toilets and household latrines were also damaged. Furthermore, another series of floods in 2010 displaced 34,553 people and destroyed 5512 houses [ 6]. These pressures exacerbate the increasing poverty levels encountered in this region [ 7] and threaten the attainment of development goals.
